title: Twins unveil Spring Training Caravan plans
subtitle: Twins unveil Spring Training Caravan plans
body: The Twins are not waiting for their pitchers and catchers to report to Spring Training to increase their presence around Fort Myers, Fla.  On Thursday, the club announced plans for a Spring Training Caravan and youth baseball clinics that will take place next week.  From Jan. 11-13 around Fort Myers -- their Spring Training home since 1991 -- the caravan will feature various Twins players, Minor League coach Tommy Watkins, retired radio voice John Gordon and mascot T.C. Bear. Mark Sheldon is a reporter for MLB.com. Read his blog, Mark My Word, and follow him on Twitter @m_sheldon. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Mark Sheldon
